Experts suggest that law enforcement agencies should take an active role in engaging with the community to build strong relationships and promote trust. This can include attending community meetings, conducting outreach programs, and hosting public events. By taking the initiative to engage with the community, law enforcement agencies can demonstrate a willingness to listen to residents' concerns, promote transparency, and provide education on crime prevention.

Research has shown that when law enforcement agencies effectively engage with communities, crime rates can go down, and residents are more likely to report criminal activity, which subsequently leads to safer neighborhoods. By working together, the community and law enforcement can create a collaborative and proactive approach to reducing crime and fostering safer and more cohesive neighborhoods.
